description: Replacement of front windows with double glazed white powder coated aluminium casement windows and replacement of rear windows and doors with double glazed white UPVC casement and sliding sash windows.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning from the date of this decision notice.Reason: To comply with the provisions of Section 91(1)(a) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004).
The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the approved plans listed in this notice.Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

All works of making good to the retained fabric shall be finished to match the adjacent work with regards to the methods used and to material, colour, texture and profile, unless the prior written approval of the local planning authority is obtained to any variation, or except where otherwise stated on the approved drawings.Reason:  To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory (Policy 36 of the London Borough of Lambeth Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 2007: Policies saved beyond 5 August 2010 and not superseded by the LDF Core Strategy January 2011 and S9 of the London Borough of Lambeth Core Strategy (January 2011)).

Notwithstanding the plans hereby approved, the lead bar strips shall be integrated within the windows and not stuck on.Reason:  To ensure that the external appearance of the buildings are satisfactory and that to protect the visual amenity of the terrace and surrounding area (Policies 31 and 36 of the London Borough of Lambeth Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 2007: Policies saved beyond 5 August 2010 and not superseded by the LDF Core Strategy January 2011 and S9 of the London Borough of Lambeth Core Strategy (January 2011)).

The window and door replacements hereby approved at no's 289 - 307 Clapham Road are to be undertaken as one development and works are not to be substantially completed at any property until such a time as the works are completed at the other properties. Reason: To ensure that a partially completed development does not result in an obtrusive and incompatible form of development, and to ensure that the terrace maintains a consistent and uniform appearance (Policies 31, 33 and 36 of the Unitary Development Plan 2007: Policies saved beyond 5th August 2010 and not superseded by the Core Strategy: January 2011).
